slides.title: Welcome to Taxation in Tally
slides.content:
# Taxation in Tally

Tally provides comprehensive **GST and tax compliance** features.

## What You Will Learn

- **GST Configuration** - Setting up GST
- **GST Transactions** - Recording with correct tax
- **Tax Returns** - GSTR-1, GSTR-3B preparation
- **TDS/TCS** - Withholding tax compliance

## Taxes Supported

| Tax | Description |
|-----|-------------|
| GST | Goods and Services Tax |
| TDS | Tax Deducted at Source |
| TCS | Tax Collected at Source |

## GST Rates in India

| Rate | Examples |
|------|----------|
| 0% | Essentials, exports |
| 5% | Basic necessities |
| 12% | Processed food |
| 18% | Most goods/services |
| 28% | Luxury goods |

> **Tally simplifies** GST compliance!

slides.title: GST Configuration
slides.content:
# Setting Up GST

## Enabling GST

**F11 > Statutory & Taxation**

```
Enable GST: Yes
Set GST Details: Yes
```

## Company GST Details

```
State: Maharashtra
Registration Type: Regular
GSTIN: 27AABCT1234P1Z5
```

## Registration Types

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| Regular | Normal registration |
| Composition | Small business |
| Consumer | Unregistered |
| SEZ | Special Economic Zone |

## Tax Ledgers Required

```
CGST Input/Output - Duties & Taxes
SGST Input/Output - Duties & Taxes
IGST Input/Output - Duties & Taxes
```

## HSN/SAC Codes

- **HSN** - For Goods
- **SAC** - For Services

| Turnover | Digits Required |
|----------|----------------|
| Up to 1.5 Cr | Optional |
| 1.5 to 5 Cr | 4 digits |
| Above 5 Cr | 6 digits |

> **Correct configuration** is the foundation!

slides.title: Party GST Details
slides.content:
# Party Master with GST

## Customer Setup

```
Ledger: ABC Traders
Under: Sundry Debtors
State: Maharashtra
GSTIN: 27AABCA1234P1Z5
Party Type: Registered Regular
```

## Party Types

| Type | GST Impact |
|------|------------|
| Registered Regular | Normal B2B |
| Composition | No ITC |
| Unregistered | B2C |
| Consumer | End consumer |

## Intra vs Inter State

| Type | Tax Applied |
|------|-------------|
| Intra-State | CGST + SGST |
| Inter-State | IGST |

### Example

```
Seller: Maharashtra (27)
Buyer: Maharashtra (27)
Tax: CGST 9% + SGST 9%

Seller: Maharashtra (27)
Buyer: Karnataka (29)
Tax: IGST 18%
```

> **Accurate party details** ensure correct GST!

slides.title: GST Sales Transactions
slides.content:
# Recording GST Sales

## Intra-State Sale (B2B)

```
Party: ABC Traders (GSTIN: 27AABC...)
Item: Laptop - Rs. 50,000
CGST @ 9%: Rs. 4,500
SGST @ 9%: Rs. 4,500
Total: Rs. 59,000
```

## Inter-State Sale (B2B)

```
Party: DEF Corp (GSTIN: 29AADEF...)
Place of Supply: Karnataka
Item: Laptop - Rs. 50,000
IGST @ 18%: Rs. 9,000
Total: Rs. 59,000
```

## B2C Sale

```
Party: Walk-in Customer
Item: Mobile - Rs. 20,000
CGST @ 9%: Rs. 1,800
SGST @ 9%: Rs. 1,800
Total: Rs. 23,600
```

## Automatic Entries

```
Customer A/c (Dr)    59,000
Sales A/c (Cr)       50,000
CGST Output (Cr)      4,500
SGST Output (Cr)      4,500
```

> **Correct invoice** ensures GST compliance!

slides.title: GST Purchase Transactions
slides.content:
# Recording GST Purchases

## Purchase with Input Credit

```
Party: XYZ Suppliers
Item: Raw Material - Rs. 100,000
CGST Input @ 9%: Rs. 9,000
SGST Input @ 9%: Rs. 9,000
Total: Rs. 118,000
```

## Accounting Entry

```
Raw Material (Dr)     100,000
CGST Input (Dr)         9,000
SGST Input (Dr)         9,000
Vendor (Cr)           118,000
```

## Net GST Calculation

```
CGST Output: Rs. 4,500
CGST Input: (Rs. 9,000)
CGST Credit: (Rs. 4,500)

SGST Output: Rs. 4,500
SGST Input: (Rs. 9,000)
SGST Credit: (Rs. 4,500)
```

## ITC Ineligible Items

- Personal use items
- Blocked credits
- Non-business use

> **Track input credit** to optimize tax!

slides.title: Credit and Debit Notes
slides.content:
# GST in Returns

## Credit Note (Ctrl+F8)

**When to Issue:**
- Goods returned by customer
- Price reduction after sale

```
Original Invoice: GST/001
Party: ABC Traders
Reason: Goods Returned
Item: Laptop - Rs. 50,000
CGST: Rs. 4,500
SGST: Rs. 4,500
```

## Debit Note (Ctrl+F9)

**When to Issue:**
- Goods returned to vendor
- Price reduction claim

```
Original Invoice: SUP-001
Party: XYZ Suppliers
Item: Raw Material - Rs. 10,000
CGST: Rs. 900
SGST: Rs. 900
```

## Impact on GSTR

| Document | GSTR Impact |
|----------|-------------|
| Credit Note | Reduces output tax |
| Debit Note | Reduces input credit |

> **Timely notes** ensure accurate reporting!

slides.title: GST Reports
slides.content:
# GST Reporting in Tally

**Path:** Gateway > Display > Statutory Reports > GST

## GSTR-1 Sections

| Section | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| B2B | Sales to registered |
| B2CS | Sales to consumers |
| CDNR | Credit/Debit notes |

## GSTR-3B Summary

```

Output Tax: Rs. 3,24,000
Inward Supplies: Rs. 12,00,000
Input Tax Credit: Rs. 2,16,000
Net Tax Payable: Rs. 1,08,000
```

## Exporting for Filing

- Export to JSON for GST portal
- Export to Excel for review

> **Tally generates** filing-ready returns!

slides.title: E-Way Bill
slides.content:
# E-Way Bill in Tally

## What is E-Way Bill?

Required for **movement of goods** worth more than Rs. 50,000.

## When Required

| Scenario | E-Way Bill |
|----------|------------|
| Inter-state > 50,000 | Mandatory |
| Intra-state > 50,000 | Varies by state |

## E-Way Bill Fields

```
Transport Mode: Road
Vehicle No: MH01AB1234
Distance: 150 KM
Transporter ID: 27AABCT...
```

## Validity

| Distance | Validity |
|----------|----------|
| Up to 100 KM | 1 day |
| Each 100 KM | +1 day |

## Generation

1. Configure GST connected
2. Enter voucher with transport
3. Generate E-Way Bill
4. Get EBN number

> **E-Way Bill** is mandatory for transport!

slides.title: TDS Configuration
slides.content:
# Tax Deducted at Source

## Enabling TDS

**F11 > Statutory Features**

```
Enable TDS: Yes
TAN: MUMT12345E
```

## Common TDS Sections

| Section | Nature | Rate |
|---------|--------|------|
| 194C | Contractor | 1-2% |
| 194J | Professional | 10% |
| 194I | Rent | 10% |
| 194H | Commission | 5% |

## TDS Ledger Setup

```
Ledger: TDS on Professional
Under: Duties & Taxes
Nature: 194J
Rate: 10%
```

## Party TDS Settings

```
Ledger: ABC Consultants
PAN: AABCC1234D
TDS Deductible: Yes
TDS Section: 194J
```

> **Correct TDS setup** ensures compliance!

slides.title: TDS Transactions
slides.content:
# Recording TDS

## Payment with TDS

```
Payment to: ABC Consultants
Invoice: Rs. 100,000

Professional Fees (Dr) 100,000
TDS 194J (Cr)           10,000
ABC Consultants (Cr)    90,000
```

## TDS on Rent

```
Rent Expense (Dr)       50,000
TDS on Rent 194I (Cr)    5,000
Landlord A/c (Cr)       45,000
```

## TDS Payment to Govt

```
TDS 194J (Dr)           10,000
TDS 194I (Dr)            5,000
Bank (Cr)               15,000

Challan No: 12345
BSR Code: 1234567
```

## Due Dates

| Activity | Due Date |
|----------|----------|
| TDS Payment | 7th of next month |
| TDS Return | Quarterly |

> **Deduct and deposit TDS** on time!

slides.title: TCS in Tally
slides.content:
# Tax Collected at Source

## What is TCS?

Tax **collected from buyer** at time of sale for specified goods.

## TCS Rates

| Category | Rate |
|----------|------|
| Scrap | 1% |
| Motor Vehicle > 10L | 1% |
| Sale > 50L | 0.1% |

## Enabling TCS

**F11 > Statutory**

```
Enable TCS: Yes
```

## TCS in Sales

```
Sale Value: Rs. 75,00,000

Customer A/c (Dr)    75,07,500
Sales (Cr)           75,00,000
TCS on Sales (Cr)        7,500
```

## TCS Returns

- Form 27EQ - Quarterly return
- Generate from Tally reports

> **Collect and remit TCS** as required!

slides.title: GST Reconciliation
slides.content:
# GST Data Reconciliation

## Why Reconcile?

- Match books with GST portal
- Verify Input Tax Credit
- Catch errors before filing

## GSTR-2A/2B Reconciliation

```
Supplier | Portal | Books | Diff
ABC Ltd  | 9,000  | 9,000 | 0
XYZ Inc  | 4,500  | 4,500 | 0
MNO Co   | 0      | 3,600 | (3,600)

Issue: MNO not filed - ITC at risk
```

## Common Mismatches

| Issue | Action |
|-------|--------|
| Supplier not filed | Follow up |
| Amount difference | Verify invoice |
| GSTIN mismatch | Correct party |

## Monthly Checklist

- Verify all invoices entered
- Check party GSTIN
- Reconcile with 2A/2B
- Review exceptions

> **Regular reconciliation** prevents ITC loss!

slides.title: GST Due Dates
slides.content:
# GST Compliance Calendar

## Monthly Filings

| Return | Due Date |
|--------|----------|
| GSTR-1 | 11th of next month |
| GSTR-3B | 20th of next month |

## Quarterly (QRMP)

| Return | Due Date |
|--------|----------|
| GSTR-1 | 13th of quarter+1 |
| GSTR-3B | 22nd/24th of quarter+1 |

## Annual

| Return | Due Date |
|--------|----------|
| GSTR-9 | 31st December |

## Penalties

| Default | Penalty |
|---------|--------|
| Late filing | Rs. 50/day |
| Late payment | 18% interest |

> **Meeting deadlines** avoids penalties!

slides.title: GST Payment
slides.content:
# Recording GST Payment

## GST Liability

```
Output Tax:
  CGST: Rs. 50,000
  SGST: Rs. 50,000

Input Credit:
  CGST: Rs. 40,000
  SGST: Rs. 40,000

Net Payable:
  CGST: Rs. 10,000
  SGST: Rs. 10,000
```

## Payment Entry

```
Bank Account (Cr)     20,000
CGST Output (Dr)      10,000
SGST Output (Dr)      10,000
```

## ITC Utilization Order

```
IGST Credit: IGST > CGST > SGST
CGST Credit: CGST > IGST
SGST Credit: SGST > IGST
```

> **Timely payment** avoids interest!

slides.title: Exception Reports
slides.content:
# GST Validation

## Tally Exception Reports

**Path:** GST > Exception Reports

### Common Exceptions

| Exception | Issue |
|-----------|-------|
| Missing GSTIN | Party incomplete |
| Invalid HSN | Wrong code |
| Rate mismatch | Check item setup |
| Place missing | No supply place |

## Fixing Exceptions

### Missing GSTIN
- Update party ledger
- Add valid GSTIN

### Invalid HSN
- Correct HSN code in item
- Verify against GST schedule

### Rate Mismatch
- Check item tax category
- Verify ledger rates

## Pre-Filing Checklist

- [ ] Fix all exceptions
- [ ] Verify totals
- [ ] Reconcile 2A/2B
- [ ] Check cash ledger

> **Fix exceptions** before filing!

slides.title: Tax Best Practices
slides.content:
# Tax Compliance Best Practices

## Data Entry

| Practice | Benefit |
|----------|--------|
| Real-time entry | Current data |
| Verify GSTIN | Correct credit |
| HSN on all items | Classification |

## Monthly Tasks

**Before 10th:**
- Complete all sales entries
- Verify B2B invoices

**Before 20th:**
- Verify input credit
- Reconcile with 2A/2B
- Make payment

## Common Errors

| Error | Impact |
|-------|--------|
| Wrong GSTIN | ITC rejected |
| Wrong HSN | Penalties |
| Wrong state | Wrong tax |

## Audit Preparation

- All invoices on file
- Return acknowledgments
- Payment proofs
- Reconciliation records

> **Good practices** ensure compliance!
